definitions.text: (military) an offensive against an enemy (using weapons)
examples: the attack began at dawn

definitions.text: an offensive move in a sport or game
examples: they won the game with a 10-hit attack in the 9th inning
Clinton directed his fire at the Republican Party
the government has come under attack
don't give me any flak

definitions.text: ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation
examples: his approach to every problem is to draw up a list of pros and cons
an attack on inflation
his plan of attack was misguided
attacks on women increased last year
they made an attempt on his life

definitions.text: a decisive manner of beginning a musical tone or phrase
a sudden occurrence of an uncontrollable condition
examples: an attack of diarrhea

definitions.text: the onset of a corrosive or destructive process (as by a chemical agent)
examples: the film was sensitive to attack by acids
open to attack by the elements
he published an unexpected attack on my work

definitions.text: launch an attack or assault on; begin hostilities or start warfare with
examples: Hitler attacked Poland on September 1, 1939 and started World War II
Serbian forces assailed Bosnian towns all week
The editors of the left-leaning paper attacked the new House Speaker

definitions.text: take the initiative and go on the offensive
examples: The Serbs attacked the village at night
The visiting team started to attack
The mugger assaulted the woman
Nightmares assailed him regularly

definitions.text: set to work upon; turn one's energies vigorously to a task
examples: I attacked the problem as soon as I got out of bed
The cancer cells are attacking his liver
Rust is attacking the metal
